content:
You are a reader assistant. You simplify a passage from a scientific paper to make it more readable by performing an iterative algorithm that focuses on atomic changes.

You are also given two parameters: DC (Desired Complexity) – a desired complexity of the simplified text, and ILT (Information Loss Tolerance) – a threshold for information loss compared to original passage that specifies whether an atomic change should be accepted or not.

The algorithm is as follows:
1. Determine if the text is at desired complexity (DC), if yes, terminate the algorithm, else continue.
2. Identify a section of the text whose complexity is above DC.
3. Propose a simplification of the identified section.
4. Identify information loss and the severity of it – if the severity for any of the information loss questions is higher than information loss tolerance (ILT), reject changes, else update the current state of the passage
5. Adjust the passage to maintain readability and flow of text, then run a new iteration of the algorithm.

When the algorithm terminates, you print the final simplified passage

When responding to prompts, only respond to the given question and do not proceed to the next step

The passage:
Our approach deals with such situations by explicitly considering occlusions in the reward function such that the robot automatically considers to execute actions to get the human in its field of view.

DC: Average person
ILT: Medium-High
Identify which parts of the passage are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex part of the passage is the phrase "explicitly considering occlusions in the reward function such that the robot automatically considers to execute actions to get the human in its field of view." This is because it contains technical terms like "occlusions" and "reward function," and the sentence structure is somewhat convoluted.

The complexity level of the passage is approximately 8 out of 10, based on the Flesch-Kincaid readability test. This is because the passage uses moderately complex vocabulary and sentence structures that may be challenging for an average person to understand.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (Average person)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium-High) contraint. Only provide the identified section
explicitly considering occlusions in the reward function such that the robot automatically considers to execute actions to get the human in its field of view
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
considering the robot's view of the human, it automatically takes actions to see the human.
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
Our approach deals with such situations by considering the robot's view of the human, it automatically takes actions to see the human.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The original passage mentions that the robot "automatically considers to execute actions" to get the human in its field of view, whereas the simplified version states that the robot "automatically takes actions to see the human." This is an information loss of 1/5, as the simplified version loses the nuance of the robot's consideration process. The severity of this information loss is medium, as it removes some detail but still conveys the main idea. The original passage's focus on "considering occlusions in the reward function" is also lost, which is a more significant information loss with a high severity.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium-High)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

High
No
Accept the proposed simplification. Print the updated version of the passage, do not print anything else
Our approach deals with such situations by considering the robot's view of the human, it automatically takes actions to see the human.
Identify which parts of the passage are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The most complex part of the passage is the phrase "Our approach deals with such situations by considering the robot's view of the human, it automatically takes actions to see the human." This is because it still contains somewhat technical vocabulary like "approach" and "considering."

The complexity level of the passage is approximately 6 out of 10, based on the Flesch-Kincaid readability test. This is because the passage is simple and clear, but still may be slightly challenging for the average person to understand.
Is determined complexity higher than DC (Average person)? Answer "Yes" or "No"
Yes
Identify a single complicated section of the passage. Remember to respect the ILT (Medium-High) contraint. Only provide the identified section
Our approach deals with such situations
Simplify this section. Only provide the proposed simplification
It deals with such situations
Reincorporate the simplified section into the passage
It deals with such situations by considering the robot's view of the human, it automatically takes actions to see the human.

Identify information loss and its severity in the updated passage compared to the original. Comparison must be between the originally provided (the very first) passage and the current simplified version. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

The original passage mentions that the approach "deals with such situations by explicitly considering occlusions in the reward function such that the robot automatically considers to execute actions to get the human in its field of view." The simplified version removes the details about "occlusions in the reward function" and "execute actions to get the human in its field of view", resulting in an information loss of 3/5. The severity of this information loss is high, as it removes specific and important details. This information loss is higher than the ILT (Medium-High), indicating that the simplification should not be accepted.
What is the highest severity level identified in your last answer? Is it higher than ILT (Medium-High)? Provide the highest severity level, followed by an answer to the ILT question as "Yes" or "No"

High
Yes
Revert the last proposed change. In further iterations you may still attempt to simplify this section in other ways. Print the reverted passage, do not print anything else
It deals with such situations by considering the robot's view of the human, it automatically takes actions to see the human.
Identify which parts of the passage are the most complex, then the complexity level of the passage. Limit your answer to a maximum of 5 sentences

This is because the passage is still somewhat simple and clear, but may be slightly challenging for the average person to understand. The phrase "it deals with such situations" is also a bit vague and could be improved for clarity.
